constructs.name: Novelty_Seeking_Trait
constructs.description: Stable personality tendency to seek stimulation, variety, and new experiences

constructs.name: Work_Role_Fragmentation
constructs.description: Degree to which job/role requires attending to multiple distinct responsibilities and domains

constructs.name: Context_Switching_Frequency
constructs.description: How often one makes unplanned switches between tasks, apps, or attentional targets

constructs.name: Sleep_Quality
constructs.description: Restorative quality of sleep the previous night

constructs.name: General_Stress_Level
constructs.description: Overall psychological stress and pressure experienced

constructs.name: Cognitive_Fatigue
constructs.description: Mental tiredness and depleted cognitive resources

constructs.name: Self_Regulation_Capacity
constructs.description: Available capacity to control impulses and regulate behavior

constructs.name: Perceived_Task_Overwhelm
constructs.description: Feeling of having too much to do and being unable to manage it all

constructs.name: Switching_Habit_Strength
constructs.description: Automaticity and strength of habitual context-switching behavior patterns

constructs.name: Task_Engagement_Level
constructs.description: Degree of absorption, focus, and involvement in the current task

constructs.name: Task_Aversiveness
constructs.description: How unpleasant, difficult, or unappealing current tasks feel

constructs.name: Boredom_Understimulation
constructs.description: Feeling understimulated, lacking interest, or insufficiently engaged

constructs.name: Anxious_Restlessness
constructs.description: Jittery anxiety, inability to sit still, urge to do something else

constructs.name: Task_Clarity
constructs.description: Knowing clearly what to do next and how to proceed with work

constructs.name: Notification_Interruption_Load
constructs.description: Amount of external notifications, pings, and interruptions received

constructs.name: Digital_Environment_Friction
constructs.description: Barriers and friction built into digital environment that make switching harder

edges.description: Higher task engagement reduces the pull toward switching contexts
Greater self-regulation allows resisting impulses to switch
Stronger habits make switching more automatic and frequent
Restless anxiety drives seeking relief through switching
Boredom drives seeking novelty through switching
More notifications trigger more context switches
Higher friction makes switching more effortful and less frequent
Higher novelty-seeking increases baseline tendency toward switching
More aversive tasks increase escape-motivated switching
Higher stress impairs sleep quality
Overstimulation from switching disrupts sleep restoration
Poor sleep increases stress reactivity and baseline stress
Feeling overwhelmed directly increases stress
Fragmented roles with multiple demands create ongoing stress
Poor sleep leads to starting the day already fatigued
Chronic stress depletes cognitive resources
Frequent switching is cognitively expensive and depleting
Low physical energy contributes to mental fatigue
Good sleep restores self-regulation resources
Mental fatigue depletes self-regulation capacity
Physical energy supports self-regulation efforts
Stress depletes self-regulation resources
Fragmented roles with many domains create overwhelm
Switching prevents task completion, accumulating unfinished work
Good sleep restores physical energy
Each switching episode reinforces and strengthens the habit
Clear understanding of what to do enables deeper engagement
Aversive tasks reduce willingness to engage
Mental fatigue impairs ability to engage deeply
Physical energy supports sustained engagement
Boredom reflects and causes disengagement from tasks
Restless state interferes with focused engagement
When tired, tasks feel more difficult and aversive
Stress magnifies negative perception of tasks
Overwhelm makes individual tasks feel more daunting
Unclear tasks feel more aversive due to uncertainty
High novelty seekers are more prone to boredom
Clear tasks provide direction that reduces boredom
Tedious aversive tasks create boredom
Stress manifests as anxious, restless state
Overwhelm creates anxiety and restless urge to act
Constant notifications create vigilant, restless state
Poor sleep increases anxiety reactivity
Fatigue reduces emotional regulation, increasing restlessness
Mental fatigue impairs clear thinking about tasks
Overwhelm clouds judgment about what to prioritize
Higher friction environments reduce notification exposure
Self-regulation enables proactive environment design
